basics.name: Philip Posgate
basics.label: Software Programmer / Architect
basics.summary: I am an accomplished Software Programmer, Technical Architect, and Team Lead, specializing mainly in enterprise development using Java/J2EE, Web, Mobile, and database technologies. I have 22 years of experience in software product development, including requirements definition, business & technical analysis, design, prototyping, agile and iterative development methodologies, testing, deployments, and maintenance. I have excellent communication and people skills, team leadership and project management experience.

work.summary: Mississauga, Ontario - Rapid software design and development of a modern J2EE application, in collaboration with an agile development team, TD enterprise engineers, cloud specialists, and RedHat consultants.
highlights: Technology research and deep analysis of legacy banking applications.
Decision centric software architecture, using BRMS and BPMS technologies.

work.position: Java Developer, Designer, Analyst & Team Leader
work.summary: Dundas, Ontario - Senior designer/developer of Orbis J2EE-based products and services. Mentored and managed junior developers to become productive members of the development team. Lots of communication and support to business team and clients. Key technologies that I worked with include: Java, Tomcat, MySQL, MS SQLServer, Oracle, Javascript, JQuery, Jasper Reports, Spring, Hibernate, LDAP, JSON, XML, 2 of 8 HTML, PhoneGap, Ajax, SOAP/REST web services, ecommerce.
highlights: Application design and iterative software development

work.summary: Vancouver, BC - Designed, built, and maintained a B2B software application that integrated elements of EA's enterprise systems with a remote corporate-partner system. More specifically, this J2EE “middle-ware” application integrated with 1) a MySQL database, 2) a “Tibco” JMS messaging system, 3) a remote application via HTTP/REST protocols, and 4) accessed the remote third-party application via HTTP/SOAP protocols (co-developed by myself and third-party development team) over a secure VPN. The business purpose of this project was to marshal, process and proxy EA customer data (i.e. online gamer data) to the remote third-party partner, thus creating the B2B relationship. The application had to support a high volume of real-time incoming data, which meant it had to be designed with high performance and reliability in mind. This application's core architecture relied on Spring, integrating separately designed software modules, built and packaged using the 'Maven' build tool. This greatly simplified and sped up development time. Other key technologies employed were Hibernate (for MySQL database access), JMX MBeans (for remote jconsole management), Adobe Flex (for rich administrative user interface), Axis2 (for SOAP communications), Apache- commons 'httpclient' api (for REST integration), Apache's 'xmlbeans' api (for xml processing) and a variety of other Java api's. This project's development methodology could be best described as a “loosely agile” in nature.
highlights: Application Design and Iterative Development Planning

work.summary: Vancouver, BC - Lead a software development team that designed, built, and maintained the online casino at www.bodog.com. This included both integration with third-party casino-system provider (www.realtimegaming.com), as well as the development of an in-house casino system using Flash/Flex and Java/J2EE on a clustered JBoss 4 environment. Extensive use of Maven2 (maven.apache.org) and ‘agile’ development methodologies.
highlights: Application Design and Iterative Development Planning

work.summary: Sydney, Australia - Helped design and build a series of J2EE web applications using Struts, Oracle 9i Application Server, and Oracle 9i Database. The purpose of these applications was to provide access and control of departmental information to internal and external users.

work.position: Team Lead, Analyst, Designer & Java Developer
work.summary: Vancouver, BC - Omega Tours International (OTI). A web application for booking hotel reservations and managing orders. Integration with GTA reservation system and Moneris payment gateway.
Vancouver, BC - Tantalus was a software development consultancy with many clients.  I worked on several projects as business analyst, designer, team lead, Java and Oracle Developer

Vancouver, BC - Portal sites delivering dynamic financial information to the trader/broker community. Software Support Technician – PowerTrader Pro Q & A for software development team. PowerTrader Pro was a desktop application for stock traders. It read a real-time “datafeed” of stock quotes and stored them in a database where they could be stored for real-time retrieval and analysis.
highlights: Java applet developer – threaded, realtime stock tickers
Supported users of PowerTrader Pro – telephone and ‘on site’
A Q&A tester for the development team

work.summary: Toronto, Ontario - WinFax Pro software support technician
highlights: Helped WinFax users with technical problems over the telephone and email
